bibl.title: Dispatch from Henry Rider to William H. Seward, March 21, 1863
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.opener:
Consulate of the United States of America at Sierra Leone
March 21st 1863
Hon William H. Seward Secretary of State Washingtion D.C. Sir
div1.p: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of a communication from you dated the 21st day of May 1862 which arrived at this consulate office during my absence on leave.

I beg leave to say that in writing to the Department for promotion, I was under the impression that having been in the service some three years as consular agent, it was in the power of the Department of State to give me a Counsul commission without regard to outside influence.

I have the honor to enclose copies of late treatys between this
Colonial Government and the native Chiefs occupying the territory around the Colony.

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be Sir
Your most obdt servant
